title: As an BOC Intl Ama Admin User, I no longer want Clubs to be able to trade Intl slot values
custom_preconds: AC:* Beginning October 15th (when the current signing period ends), Clubs will no longer have the ability to trade International Slot Money* When entering a new Outright (Trade), International Signing Bonus Pool will not be an available option when clicking on ‰Û÷Add Consideration‰Ûª* This will be true for the next signing period, but the subsequent signing period* Clubs will no longer be able to increase their Max Pool Amount on the Intl Signing Bonus Tracker

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to Display Position on Transactions That Add Player to Active MJ Roster
custom_preconds: Wires: * [https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=sign_free_agent|https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=sign_free_agent]* [https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=selection_to_ml_roster|https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=selection_to_ml_roster]* [https://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=rule_5_selection|https://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=rule_5_selection]*AC:** Transactions that add a player to the Active MJ Rosters in-season (26-man roster, 28-man roster in September) should display the position the player is going to be added to the roster with** MJSEL** SIGNFA** R5SEL* This field should not be editable for Club User* This field should be editable for BOC Admin Users* If a BOC User updates the position, the player‰Ûªs primary position will be updated* A player optioned pre-Opening Day, then later recalled would also have it on their recall transaction (even though on the 40).  It is all about being added to the ML active roster.* This is only when the player is added to the MJ Active roster for the first time

title: Add database support for Country so that we can add countries as data fix and later, provide user data entry support
custom_preconds: We‰Ûªve had this issue for a while.  Every time we need to add a country we need to made a code fix.   This should be controlled via database so that at the very least, we can change this with a data fix. AC:* Dropdowns should be configurable** District, Province, etc* National ID should be configurable** Format** Required?

GIVEN Attachments in ebis should be written to both file DBs

custom_expected: THEN the file should be stored in both DBs (as confirmed by juan)

AND once accepted user should be logged in

AND if user attempts to refresh other tabs or navigate to previously authenticated urls they should be prompted to login again

title: As a User, I want Quick Search connected to Advanced Search
custom_preconds: *Value:*  Quick Search has filters built in to improve usage.  The ability to hit enter and complete an advanced search will help quickly find people that have fallen out of the quick search populations.*Wire:* [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=advanced_search_via_quick_search|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=advanced_search_via_quick_search]*AC:** There will be a footer row at the bottom of quick search results, as depicted in the wire** The text will say ‰ÛÏSearch more players with Advanced Search‰Û� if the search type is set to any of the player options** The text will say ‰ÛÏSearch more employees with Advanced Search‰Û� if the search type is set to employees* The footer row will have a link to Advanced Search* If a user clicks this link while using Quick Search, rather than selecting an option in the drop-down, they will be re-directed to Advance Search* The search type they had selected on Quick Search (Pro Player, Domestic Amateur, International Amateur, Employee) will be loaded as the search type* A Last Name filter will be loaded with anything typed to the left of the comma in Quick Search* A First Name filter will be loaded with anything typed to the right of the comma in Quick Search* If there is no comma, there will only be a Last Name filter added* The search will run once the page loads

title: As a User, I want to be able to search for players with a specific clause from the Contract Language widget
custom_preconds: Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contract_language_widget|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contract_language_widget]AC:* On the Contract Language widget, there will be a new 'Contracts' column added to the end of the widget* This column will display the number of contracts that contain the clause* The number of contracts will be a hyper link* Clicking the hyperlink will perform an advanced search and return the contracts that contain the clause** ContractID will need to be added as a filter on Advance Search* Users will be able to right-click and perform the search in a new tab/window* Club users should only see Contracts they have permission to see** Confirm Terms - MJ** Terms Accepted - MN** Completed - UEC

title: Service calc off by one day when player crosses 172 threshold
custom_steps: SF reported discrepancies for George Springer (https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/history?playerId=345403) and Ketel Marte (https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/history?playerId=363839). It looks like the day of the 172 rollover the rounding isn't working correctly (see slack for more info).
custom_expected:
Example for Springer:
starting MLS days: 166
Day 1(2.78, 3 rounded)-> MLS days: 168.78 -> rounds ups to 169 (5.169)
Day 2(5.56, 6 rounded)-> MLS days: 171.56 -> was previously rounding up to 172 here but we’re actually .44 away from 172 so this should calc to 6.000 on day 2(6.000)
Day 3(8.34, 8 rounded)-> Adjusted MLS days since rollover: (2.78, 3 rounded) (6.003)
Day 4(11.12, 11 rounded)-> Adjusted MLS days since rollover: (5.56, 6 rounded) (6.006)
Day 5(13.9, 14 rounded)-> Adjusted MLS days since rollover: (8.34, 8 rounded) (6.008)

title: INC0152422 - non-MLB users are  unable to email contracts
custom_steps: Since we changed to the Amazon SES gateway, users have been unable to email contracts as the domains are not verified.

title: Newly entered MJCs do not apply the adjusted calcs on the first time they are saved
custom_steps:
The actual/scheduled games are not loaded when a contract is created which means that adjusted values aren't correct on save of a prelim contract.  In general this isnt a problem, however now that threshold adj is calculated once and never again, its causing a problem.

The first time the contract is saved, it should also pull in the games adjustment and apply that to all values (in particular to any performance or other bonus thresholds)

title: As an BOC Intl Ama Admin User, I no longer want Clubs to be able to trade Intl slot values
custom_preconds: AC:* Beginning October 15th (when the current signing period ends), Clubs will no longer have the ability to trade International Slot Money* When entering a new Outright (Trade), International Signing Bonus Pool will not be an available option when clicking on ‰Û÷Add Consideration‰Ûª* This will be true for the next signing period, but the subsequent signing period* Clubs will no longer be able to increase their Max Pool Amount on the Intl Signing Bonus Tracker

custom_steps: Since we changed to the Amazon SES gateway, users have been unable to email contracts as the domains are not verified.

title: Newly entered MJCs do not apply the adjusted calcs on the first time they are saved
custom_steps:
The actual/scheduled games are not loaded when a contract is created which means that adjusted values aren't correct on save of a prelim contract.  In general this isnt a problem, however now that threshold adj is calculated once and never again, its causing a problem.

The first time the contract is saved, it should also pull in the games adjustment and apply that to all values (in particular to any performance or other bonus thresholds)

* Exports from the International Video Log will be updated to match the provided example

title: As a League Economics User, I want additional options added to the MJC Advanced Search
custom_steps:
AC:

* The following filters will be added to the Major Contract Advanced Search:
** Multi Year Term
*** Equals
**** Yes
**** No
** Signing Agent
*** Is
*** Is Not
** Signing Agency
*** Is
*** Is Not
** Signing MLS
*** Between
*** Equals
*** Greater Than
*** Greater Than Equal To
*** Less Than
*** Less Than Equal To
*** No Equals
** Confirmed Terms MLS
*** Between
*** Equals
*** Greater Than
*** Greater Than Equal To
*** Less Than
*** Less Than Equal To
*** No Equals
** Contains Award Bonuses
*** Equals
**** Yes
**** No
** Contains Performance Bonuses
*** Equals
**** Yes
**** No
** Contains Other Bonuses
*** Equals
**** Yes
**** No
** Contains Salary Escalators
*** Equals
**** Yes
**** No

title: INC0145557: E-Sig Status Fields
custom_steps:
AC:

* Signed and Read fields will not appear on the E-signature status modal until values are available to be displayed



From Gina:

On the E-Sig popup, there are labels which say â€œSignedâ€�, â€œReadâ€�, and â€œSignedâ€�. When the contract has reached those statuses, dates pop up to the right of the labels. Gina was saying that it is a bit confusing to see the labels without the dates, because it implies that the contract was signed and read when it actually wasnâ€™t. So she was wondering if the label(s) should be hidden until there is an action. I.e., it wouldnâ€™t show â€œSignedâ€� until it was actually signed on a date, it wouldnâ€™t show â€œReadâ€� until it was actually read on a date, etc.

In the attachment, right now it shows "Signed" but there isn't a date next to it (because it's a label). That label shouldn't appear _until_ there's a date associated with that event.

title: As a BOC Trans Super Admin User, I want to see a Roster Notes widget on the MJ/MN Roster Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is a BOC Trans Super Admin
AND wants to see Roster Notes widget
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to MJ/MN Rosters tab 

Wireframe: [https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=major_league_roster|https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=major_league_roster]
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Trans Super Admin users will see an expandable comment section as depicted in wireframe
AND Clicking "expand" will expand the section
AND Clicking "collapse" will collapse the section
AND Roster Notes widget will be collapsed by default, unless there are comments present
AND Clicking save will commit the changes made to the comments section
AND This will be a shared comment box (all Trans Super Admins can view comments entered)
AND notes widget will have 800 character limit
AND comments will be unique to each ORG

title: As a user I want the contract language advanced search to return results
custom_steps:
Update the contract langauge advanced search to use dbms_lob.instr (or other functions in that package) to improve performance.

Example SQL showing usage:

select 
   langdata.LANGUAGE_DATA_ID
from 
   LANGUAGE_CUSTOM cust 
JOIN (select CLAUSE_TYPE_ID from clause_type_lkup where language_level_id = 2) clauseType 
    on clauseType.CLAUSE_TYPE_ID = cust.CLAUSE_TYPE_ID
Join LANGUAGE_DATA langdata 
    on cust.LANGUAGE_DATA_ID = langdata.LANGUAGE_DATA_ID
where 
   dbms_lob.instr(lower(LANGUAGE_DATA_CLOB_SEARCHABLE),'recoup')>0;

title: As a User, I want some kind of indication that I'm about to merge a Clearinghouse profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge|https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge]

AC:

* When performing a merge of two International Amateurs, the user will be notified on the merge modal if either of the profiles were created as part of the Clearinghouse program
** A profile will be considered a Clearinghouse profile if it has a Drug Test Request attached to it.
* If one of the profiles is a Clearinghouse profile, the following text will appear in red at the top of the modal:
** â€œWarning: You are attempting to merge a Clearinghouse profile.â€�
* There will be a new â€œClearinghouseâ€� row added to the merge modal
** It will appear between PlayerID and Last Name
* If either profile has a Drug Test Request attached to it, â€œYesâ€� will appear in the Clearinghouse row

title: As a User, I want to the Clearinghouse ebisID retained when merging
custom_steps:
AC:

* When performing a merge of intl amateur players, if one of the profiles is a Clearinghouse profile, the system will retain that ebisID when the merge is completed
** Currently, the logic is to keep the oldest ebisID
* Communication with LARI AID should not break as a results of one of these merges

Hi EBIS team,

Our department is looking to enhance the information that appears when we search for Investigations under the â€œAdvanced Searchâ€� function. The attached report is the data we currently get.

We would like to add the following columns (all data that is currently in EBIS but not in this report):

Including these columns will make the analyses we do on Investigations much more efficient.

Thanks.

Ernesto.

title: INC0146970 - Updated CBT/LRD Cash Accounting For Payroll Reports
custom_steps:
In order to account for adjustments made to the cash transactions which affect CBT and LRD payrolls we will add an additional collapsible section to the outright trade transaction called â€œCash Payroll Allocationsâ€�.  The values that display in this section should match up with the values that are displaying on the payrolls in the cash transaction section.

AC:   

* There will be a new â€œCash Payroll Allocationsâ€� collapsible section on outright trades
* The section will display two lists, one for CBT and one for LRD payments
* Each list will have the following columns:
** Payor Org
** Payee Org
** Payment year
** Payment amount
** garbage can for deleting payment (edit mode only)
* There will be an â€˜addâ€™ button below each list that adds a new, blank row to the list
* The section should only be editable by users with a new permission â€œEBIS-TX-PAYROLL-CASH-EDITORSâ€�
* Prior to approval, the section is not visible
* Once the transaction is approved, the section is visible and changes can be made
* Updates made to the payments should be reflected on the associated payroll (CBT or LRD) when run for an as of date
* When saving a payroll, any updates on the transaction should be reflected in the cash transactions sections

Cameronâ€™s original email:

Hey Guys-

I wanted to flag an item for discussion after we return from arbitration. As more Clubsâ€™ payrolls have been proximate to the CBT threshold, we would like to revisit the way we account for cash on the Payrolls reports when it is run â€œas ofâ€� a certain date. Right now, my understanding is that EBIS has some fairly convoluted back-end logic to calculate the CBT allocations on multi-year cash transactions, and thereâ€™s not really any way we can update the resulting calculations.

What I would like to do, if possible, is apply that same logic to an additional feature on each Outright (Trade) page. What Iâ€™m envisioning, on the Mookie Betts trade as an example, would be an additional collapsible section titled â€œCash Payroll Allocationsâ€� for trades that include cash considerations. This section would have the same back-end logic that EBIS has now, except only BOC users could adjust the yearly allocations. When running payrolls â€œas ofâ€� a certain date, the cash would pull from the allocations assigned to each trade page rather than the back-end logic. Basically, it would give us the ability to make manual adjustments to cash, which many Clubs have requested.

Let me know if thereâ€™s a good time in early March to discuss this new feature, and I can put together a more robust description of the desired functionality in the interim.

Thanks,
Cameron

title: As a developer I would like to add the ability to clone a production user in a non production environment
custom_preconds: NOTE:FOR THIS TEST CASE WE WILL NEED TO CONFIRM THAT THIS FUNCTIONALITY WORKS IN "NON-PROD" ENVIRONMENTS BUT THIS FUNCTIONALITY SHOULD NOT EXIST IN PRODUCTION
custom_steps:
On the user accounts page in a non production environment once a user is loaded there should be an option to clone an existing production user.  

The list of production users should be within the same org as the loaded user

Cloning will remove and store all permission for the existing user and replace them with the ones associated with the prod user.

title: As a developer I would like to revert a cloned production user in a non production environment back to the user's original permissions
custom_preconds: NOTE:FOR THIS TEST CASE WE WILL NEED TO CONFIRM THAT THIS FUNCTIONALITY WORKS IN "NON-PROD" ENVIRONMENTS BUT THIS FUNCTIONALITY SHOULD NOT EXIST IN PRODUCTION
custom_steps:
On the user accounts page in a non production environment once a previously cloned user is loaded there should be:
An indicator that the user is cloned and to which production account they are cloned.  
An option to revert the user back to their original permissions.

title: Add version dropdown to ebis link utility
custom_steps: Ebis link now has multiple versions which the user can query.  In order to simplify querying for them, we will add a version dropdown to the link utility.The dropdown should be right below the Request dropdown and should list all versions for which the end point is available.To handle this, we will need to add an ebis link version table with an assoc table between that and EBIS_LINK_ENDPOINTS_LKUP.  We'll add another procedure call to add a version to each endpoint add add those calls directly below each item in the utilities lookup.sql.The only change in functionality will be to add /v1/ at the front of each link.   The screen should default to version 0 (for now)

title: As a User, I want to place a Pitcher on the 10-Day IL(NEEDS AC)
Highmark Updates
custom_steps: From Mike Camillone:1)	One issue is that a number of fake SSNs end up getting passed to Highmark.  Since domestic players must have an SSN in their profile in order to sign a Minor League contract, in cases where they don‰Ûªt have an SSN and they need to sign a contract, BB Ops is advising Clubs to put in a dummy SSN in order to move the process along.  This is not good for Highmark as it causes the player‰Ûªs benefits account to be set up incorrectly.  Since international players do not require an SSN in order to sign, EBIS already has logic that will include the player‰Ûªs Player ID in the Highmark file if they don‰Ûªt have an SSN.  We should do this for domestic players who don‰Ûªt have SSNs.  I understand that we shouldn‰Ûªt hold up the Club from signing the contract, so maybe we can add something to the screen in EBIS to allow the Club to specify that they are waiting for the player‰Ûªs SSN; that way, the Club would not enter a fake SSN and the Highmark batch would grab the Player ID instead.*For #1, I‰Ûªm thinking that maybe the easiest thing to do is update the Highmark batch to grab a domestic player‰Ûªs Player ID if he doesn‰Ûªt have an SSN, the same as we do for intl players.*2)	Another issue is with missing addresses for players signing their first Minor League contract.  For domestic players, DPL requires the player to have at least one address, so I would expect that address to come over to his EBIS profile.  But it seems that international players may not have an address in their profile.  An example is Bryan Encarnacion (ID 811708).  When we pass address info from EBIS to Highmark, Highmark uses it to determine which coverage plan to put the player under (US/Dominican/other).  EBIS lets the user type in an address at the time of contract signing (which is what happened with Encarnacion).  Maybe the Highmark batch should also look at this address?  Or maybe this address should be put into the player‰Ûªs profile?*For #2, I‰Ûªm thinking that the Highmark batch should grab the contract address if an address doesn‰Ûªt exist in the player profile.*

title: Add banner text when batches are running
custom_steps: As a BOC user, I want to see a banner on the EBIS website when batches are running. This will allow me to know that now is not a good time to be working on the site. This will let me know that the ebis team is not able to address the issue. We should also use this time to make it so we can put up a banner in other cases as well. Either for information, warnings, or other outages.

title: MnR Bonus Clauses
custom_steps: INC0136415From Cameron:Would like Clubs to be required to fill out data tables for PBs in Minor League UPCs such that the information can be queried from the back-end (similar to Major League UPCs). This change would also be helpful for many internal reporting processes.Questions (Matt/Brian):1.	Are we only going to do this for performance bonuses or for other addendum B clauses as well?  (If more, which ones?) 2.	Are we tracking earned information as well in addition to just the initial values? 3.	Do we want to actually check the performance bonuses against stats or are we leaving that up to users? 4.	We won‰Ûªt be able to convert the existing data, so should we modify the existing contracts to now allow this entry or just leave them as is and let new contracts enter the data? 5.	How do you envision this working in regards to the bonus payment tracking screen?  Is this in addition to that or integrated with it?  For major contracts the tracking info is just in line in the contract.  But some MNC clauses that already have this data (IBP, signing bonus, etc) are already tracked on the bonus payments screen 6.	Do we want to add the bonus payment tracking info into ebis link, exposing at least some of the data requested? Answers (Cam):1)	I think we just need clauses for performance bonuses.2)	No ‰ÛÒ that will be trackable via the MJ UPC.3)	Check in terms of whether or not they‰Ûªre earned? No, we shouldn‰Ûªt have to do that.4)	I think just new contracts is fine for now.5)	I haven‰Ûªt contemplated the Bonus Payment Tracking section, nor has ARI I believe. Can we kick this part down the road for now?6)	Yes, we definitely want this data available via the link!

title: As a User, I want a new Person BAM ID Batch created

title: As a User, I want to see a Player Programs Widget on Pro Player Profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on INFO tab of a player
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to Baseball Info section of professional player

* There will be a new Program Participation widget in the baseball info section of professional player profiles
* The new widget will match the provided wire and data discovery
* When the profile is in edit mode, there will be an Add Row button
** Clicking the Add Row button will add a row to the widget
* When rows are present, there will be a trash can icon on each row
** Clicking the trash can icon will delete the row
* There will be a comments bubble on each row that will allow the user to enter comments
* Clicking save on the profile will commit changes
* This story should also handle any necessary data conversion into the new format
** Players with existing Rookie Career Development data entered for them will have it appear correctly in the new widget
** Check how LINK responds to changes
* BOC Profile Admin users should be able to edit this widget
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a new "Program Participation" widget
AND new widget will match the provided wire and data discovery
AND there will be an Add Row button when profile is in edit mode
 ** Clicking button will a row to widget 
AND when rows are present, trash can icon will display on each row

title: INC0121072 - Hard Error for Assignment Clause
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is creating MNC with an Assignment Clause
custom_steps:
WHEN user includes an Assignment Clause in MNC
AND enters a date on Roster Type Requirement on clause prior to 3/15
custom_expected:
THEN system will perform a rule check on submit
AND if value entered is not >= 3/15
THEN system will return a HARD ERROR
AND error message will display: 
"Assignment Clause Roster Date must be between 3/15 and the end of the MJ League Season. Please contact BOC."

title: Push Rule 4 Draft Data to a queue
custom_steps: DPL needs a way to automatically update its data based on what happens in the Rule 4 Draft. We can send a message to an SNS Topic (or the GCP equivalent) to make it consumable by DPL and potentially other consumers. In the future, we may want to explore using more messages, such as when a player signs their contract.
